s.text: Striking green, yellow, and purple may appear, and sober brown and navy, too, giving the impression for a few minutes that modish black is over; but it never is--it's just waiting.

Designers' attempts to eradicate the public's devotion to black clothes, whether by self-styled bohemians in SoHo, business and media people uptown, or wealthy fashion folk around the globe, have succeeded only in fixing it more.

Designers' attempts to eradicate the public's devotion to black clothes, whether by self-styled bohemians in SoHo, business and media people uptown, or wealthy fashion folk around the globe, have succeeded only in fixing it more.
I was immediately struck by the benign, pastel tonality of the clothed population; there seemed to be a large consensual flight from the color black, that famous hue of communal refusal.
Striking green, yellow, and purple may appear, and sober brown and navy, too, giving the impression for a few minutes that modish black is over; but it never is--it's just waiting.
Chanel, a child of poverty, was very clever to allow for the sense of alienation in her chic black scheme.

It was Baldessare Castiglione (in The Book of the Courtier , finished 1516, published 1528) who first recommended black costume as a means of conveying personal distinction and a certain noble reticence.
Women's fashion hasn't been the same since, and the feminine appeal of muted black clothes, later extended to menswear for women, has kept its mainstream power.
Women's fashion hasn't been the same since, and the feminine appeal of muted black clothes, later extended to menswear for women, has kept its mainstream power.
Women's fashion hasn't been the same since, and the feminine appeal of muted black clothes, later extended to menswear for women, has kept its mainstream power.

For that very reason, perhaps, current urban opposition to the whole image-conscious mainstream is veering over to what used to look like farm clothes: the faded green-and-yellow-checkered shirts and the orange-washed-out-to-coral sweatshirts of poor and artless rural life.
Since modern black can be both high and low or right and left, it seems too versatile to lose.

Standard inexpensive clothes in stores--sweaters and skirts, let's say--came in dark blue, dark green, and maybe brown or maroon, the traditional colors of country sportswear favored by the Ivy League, and in tweedy mixtures or pale versions of the same.

Standard inexpensive clothes in stores--sweaters and skirts, let's say--came in dark blue, dark green, and maybe brown or maroon, the traditional colors of country sportswear favored by the Ivy League, and in tweedy mixtures or pale versions of the same.
It seems that the bohemian spirit has gone beyond the old war against palatable daylight hypocrisy waged in the costume of stark dark truth.
The old social hierarchies disintegrated after World War I, and boring non-fashion could become revolutionary high fashion.
The old social hierarchies disintegrated after World War I, and boring non-fashion could become revolutionary high fashion.
